alert.note: Alert for Orange; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 7:46PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Orange and Seminole. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 746 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orlando, Apopka, Altamonte Springs, Ocoee, Winter Garden, Windermere, Pine Hills, Lockhart, Zellwood, Oak Ridge, Forest City, Orlovista, Bay Hill, Clarcona, Paradise Heights, South Apopka, Gotha, Plymouth and Lake Butler. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
